title: Key Executive Departures Disrupt BlackRock’s Secondary Fundraising
sub_head: The firm’s dismissal of the three executives has resulted in their loss of carried interest, or the share of profits the trio would have earned from the fund’s investments, two people familiar with the matter said
body:
BlackRock Inc., which has been raising its second secondary investment fund with a $4 billion target, is grappling with the fallout from the departure of three senior executives who led the nascent strategy, according to people familiar with the matter.
Last week, BlackRock said it dismissed Steve Lessar, Konnin Tam and Veena Isaac after the three managing directors told the New York asset manager that they planned to leave its private-equity partners group for Apollo Global Management Inc. Apollo, also in New York, is trying to set up its own secondary investment strategy.
